description: wood tobacco box with carved design inlay in a lighter colored wood in front center; carved edges at top and bottom of box; blue cord with a blue bead attaches the box to a pipe holder, with scalloped edges and looped carved designs at top
medium: Wood, deer bone plaques; bead (glass); wood; fiber
text: This smoking kit consists of a tobacco box and pipe holder, to which a pipe would have once been attached. Prestige accessories of Ainu men, smoking kits were prominently carried on the belt; the pipe holder was tucked through the belt, leaving the box to dangle. Records show that when Ainu men met for the first time, they exchanged their kits for a smoke and to provide an opportunity to admire each other’s kit.
title: Tobacco box and pipe holder (tanpakuop)
